titles.title: Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program Reauthorization Act of 2012
Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program Reauthorization Act of 2012
Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program Reauthorization Act of 2012
To reauthorize the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program through fiscal year 2017.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 112-636.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 457.

action.text: Mr. Smith (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6062.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Scott (VA) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 8/1/2012--Passed House without amendment. Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program Reauthorization Act of 2012 - Amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to authorize appropriations for the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program through FY2017.
